sentence.Network_en: New towns are springing up to house the increasing population.
sentence.Network_cn: 新的城镇正迅速建起,以容纳不断增长的人口.

sentence.Network_en: Many new things are springing up.
Vegetarian restaurants and health food shops are springing up in every high street.
sentence.Network_cn: 每条大街上都冒出很多素食餐馆和保健食品店。

entry.def: Spring is the season between winter and summer when the weather becomes warmer and plants start to grow again.

example.ex: The Labor government of Western Australia has an election due next spring...
example.tran: 西澳大利亚工党政府明年春天要举行选举。

example.ex: We met again in the spring of 1977.
example.tran: 我们于 1977 年春季再次见面。

entry.def: A spring is a spiral of wire which returns to its original shape after it is pressed or pulled.

example.ex: Unfortunately, as a standard mattress wears, the springs soften and so do not support your spine...
example.tran: 遗憾的是，当一张标准床垫用旧后，弹簧就会变软而无法支撑你的脊椎。

example.ex: Both springs in the fuel pump were broken.
example.tran: 燃料泵里的两个弹簧都断了。

entry.def: A spring is a place where water comes up through the ground. It is also the water that comes from that place.

example.ex: To the north are the hot springs of Banyas de Sant Loan.
example.tran: 北边是班亚斯德桑隆温泉。

entry.def: When a person or animal springs, they jump upwards or forwards suddenly or quickly.

example.ex: He sprang to his feet, grabbing his keys off the coffee table...
example.tran: 他一跃而起，从茶几上一把抓起自己的钥匙。

example.ex: Outside each door a guard sprang to attention as they approached...
example.tran: 当他们走近时，每扇门外都有一名卫兵肃身立正。

entry.tran: (突然朝某个方向)迅速移动，弹开
entry.def: If something springs in a particular direction, it moves suddenly and quickly.

example.ex: Sadly when the lid of the boot sprang open, it was empty.
example.tran: 不幸的是，当后备箱的盖子弹开时，里面却是空的。

entry.tran: 突然活跃起来;突然出现
entry.def: If things or people spring into action or spring to life, they suddenly start being active or suddenly come into existence.

example.ex: When she contacted me at the beginning of August to enlist support, Sharon and I sprang into action.
example.tran: 她 8 月初和我联系请求帮助时，我和沙伦便立即行动起来了。

example.ex: ...new industries which had sprung into life during the 1920s.
example.tran: 在 20 世纪 20 年代突然出现的新型工业

entry.def: If one thing springs from another thing, it is the result of it.

example.ex: Ethiopia's art springs from her early Christian as well as her Muslim heritage...
example.tran: 埃塞俄比亚的艺术起源于其早期的基督教和伊斯兰教文化遗产。

example.ex: His anger sprang from his suffering at the loss of the most important love he had ever known in his life.
example.tran: 失去一生中的至爱让他悲痛不已，愤怒涌上他的心头。

entry.def: If a boat or container springs a leak, water or some other liquid starts coming in or out through a crack.

example.ex: The yacht has sprung a leak in the hull.
example.tran: 帆船的船体上出现了一条裂缝。

entry.tran: 冷不防地说;突然告诉(或宣布)
entry.def: If you spring some news or a surprise on someone, you tell them something that they did not expect to hear, without warning them.

example.ex: The two superpower leaders sprang a surprise at a ceremony in the White House yesterday by signing a trade deal...
example.tran: 两个超级大国的领导人昨天在白宫的一个仪式上突然签署了一项贸易协定，令人倍感意外。

example.ex: Mclaren sprang a new idea on him.
example.tran: 麦克拉伦突然告诉他一个新想法。

auth_sentence.content: The springing gives a comfortable ride for the passengers.
auth_sentence.res_content: The springing gives a comfortable ride for the passengers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The springing gives a comfortable ride for the passengers.

auth_sentence.content: New lithium-mining companies are springing up around the world.
auth_sentence.res_content: New lithium-mining companies are springing up around the world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: New lithium-mining companies are springing up around the world.

auth_sentence.content: The deals are springing up across the country.
auth_sentence.res_content: The deals are springing up across the country.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The deals are springing up across the country.
